trans-unit.source: Note: This article creates a virtual machine that is not connected to a virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Note: This article creates a virtual machine that is not connected to a virtual network.

trans-unit.source: If you want your virtual machine to use a virtual network so you can connect to your virtual machines directly by hostname or set up
trans-unit.target: If you want your virtual machine to use a virtual network so you can connect to your virtual machines directly by hostname or set up

trans-unit.source: cross-premises connections, use the From Gallery method instead and specify the virtual network when you create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: cross-premises connections, use the From Gallery method instead and specify the virtual network when you create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information about virtual networks, see <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network Overview</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about virtual networks, see <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network Overview</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure Management Portal using your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure Management Portal using your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, at the bottom left of the web page, click +New, click Virtual Machine, and then click From Gallery.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, at the bottom left of the web page, click +New, click Virtual Machine, and then click From Gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a New Virtual Machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a New Virtual Machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select a CentOS virtual machine image from Platform Images, and then click the next arrow at the bottom right of the page.
trans-unit.target: Select a CentOS virtual machine image from Platform Images, and then click the next arrow at the bottom right of the page.

trans-unit.source: On the Virtual machine configuration page, provide the following information:
trans-unit.target: On the Virtual machine configuration page, provide the following information:

trans-unit.source: Provide a Virtual Machine Name, such as "testlinuxvm".
trans-unit.target: Provide a Virtual Machine Name, such as "testlinuxvm".

trans-unit.source: Specify a New User Name, such as "newuser", which will be added to the Sudoers list file.
trans-unit.target: Specify a New User Name, such as "newuser", which will be added to the Sudoers list file.

trans-unit.source: In the New Password box, type a strong password.
trans-unit.target: In the New Password box, type a strong password.

trans-unit.source: In the Confirm Password box, retype the password.
trans-unit.target: In the Confirm Password box, retype the password.

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate Size from the drop down list.
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate Size from the drop down list.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the Virtual machine mode page, provide the following information:
trans-unit.target: On the Virtual machine mode page, provide the following information:

trans-unit.source: Select Standalone Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Select Standalone Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: In the DNS Name box, type a valid DNS address.
trans-unit.target: In the DNS Name box, type a valid DNS address.

trans-unit.source: For example, "testlinuxvm"
trans-unit.target: For example, "testlinuxvm"

trans-unit.source: In the Storage Account box, select Use an automatically generated storage account.
trans-unit.target: In the Storage Account box, select Use an automatically generated storage account.

trans-unit.source: In the Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network box, select a region where this virtual image will be hosted.
trans-unit.target: In the Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network box, select a region where this virtual image will be hosted.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the Virtual machine options page, select (none) in the Availability Set box.
trans-unit.target: On the Virtual machine options page, select (none) in the Availability Set box.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to continue.

trans-unit.source: Wait while Azure prepares your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Wait while Azure prepares your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Configure Endpoints
trans-unit.target: Configure Endpoints

trans-unit.source: After the virtual machine is created, configure endpoints in order to remotely connect.
trans-unit.target: After the virtual machine is created, configure endpoints in order to remotely connect.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Virtual Machines, click the name of your new virtual machine, then click Endpoints.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Virtual Machines, click the name of your new virtual machine, then click Endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Click Edit Endpoint at the bottom of the page, and edit the SSH endpoint so that its Public Port is 22.
trans-unit.target: Click Edit Endpoint at the bottom of the page, and edit the SSH endpoint so that its Public Port is 22.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Connect to the Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: When the virtual machine has been provisioned and the endpoints configured you can connect to it using SSH or PuTTY.
trans-unit.target: When the virtual machine has been provisioned and the endpoints configured you can connect to it using SSH or PuTTY.

trans-unit.source: Connecting Using SSH
trans-unit.target: Connecting Using SSH

trans-unit.source: If you are using Linux, connect to the virtual machine using SSH.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Linux, connect to the virtual machine using SSH.

trans-unit.source: At the command prompt, run:
trans-unit.target: At the command prompt, run:

trans-unit.source: Enter the user's password.
trans-unit.target: Enter the user's password.

trans-unit.source: Connecting using PuTTY
trans-unit.target: Connecting using PuTTY

trans-unit.source: If you are using a Windows computer, connect to the VM using PuTTY.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a Windows computer, connect to the VM using PuTTY.

trans-unit.source: PuTTY can be downloaded from the <link><linkText>PuTTY Download Page[puttydownload]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: PuTTY can be downloaded from the <link><linkText>PuTTY Download Page[puttydownload]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Download and save putty.exe to a directory on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Download and save putty.exe to a directory on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt, navigate to that folder, and execute putty.exe.
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt, navigate to that folder, and execute putty.exe.

trans-unit.source: Enter "testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net" for the Host Name and "22" for the Port.
trans-unit.target: Enter "testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net" for the Host Name and "22" for the Port.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>PuTTY Screen</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>PuTTY Screen</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Update the Virtual Machine (optional)
trans-unit.target: Update the Virtual Machine (optional)

trans-unit.source: Once you've connected to the virtual machine, you can optionally install updates.
trans-unit.target: Once you've connected to the virtual machine, you can optionally install updates.

trans-unit.source: Run:
trans-unit.target: Run:

trans-unit.source: Enter the password again.
trans-unit.target: Enter the password again.

trans-unit.source: Wait while updates install.
trans-unit.target: Wait while updates install.
